benchmark_details.name: StoryDB: Broad Multi-language Narrative Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: StoryDB is a corpus of texts that includes stories in 42 different languages. Every language includes 500+ stories. The dataset serves as a resource for the study of the role of narrative in natural language processing across various languages including low resource ones.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a large multi-language dataset of narratives to facilitate various aspects of narrative research and improve narrative generation.

data.source: Wikipedia articles that contain plot summaries in various languages.
data.annotation: Automatically tagged using categories from Wiki API and manual tagging procedures.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on performance of transformer-based models on multilabel classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance in predicting narrative tags accurately.
methodology.baseline_results: The results from models such as mBERT, mDistilBERT, and XLM-RoBERTa showed varying performance in tag classification.
methodology.validation: Evaluation performed on ten largest languages in the dataset.
